page.title: 07Woolley Park
page.content: Woolley Park is a large country estate and country house not open to the public used as a farm. The owners have lived in the area for a very long time and at one time owned most of the area around Brightwalton. It is through them that All Saints church and the school were built in the village. The parkland is used as intensively managed grazing land and has not been ploughed for many years. There are some Roe Deer in the park as well though not often seen as they tend to keep to the woods.
